result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane Michael Mcguire

defendant.name: Mcguire, Shane Michael
defendant.address: W4770 County Rd Z, Pembine, WI 54156

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 5, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

11:47 AM Defendant Shane Michael Mcguire in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Shane Michael Mcguire.  Prosecuting attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Reetz requests another status. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Clerk LS mailed copy of Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney form to defendant showing monthly payments he's to be making toward his atty fees.

2:00 PM   Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shane Michael Mcguire in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Shane Michael Mcguire.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.   Atty Reetz requests another status in 30-60 days as defendant is dealing with some medical issues.  State would like hearing sooner than later or some medical documentation as to where defendant's medical status is at.  Court questions defendant on missed court apptd atty fee payments.  Defendant indicates he paid Atty Reetz's office.  Atty Reetz will have to check on this, he may be privately retained vs court appointed.   Bond remains in effect.   (off the record and after defendant had left the courtroom, Atty Reetz advises he is court appointed, not privately retained.  Defendant must be confused as to the cash bond he posted and court appointed attorney payments.  Atty Reetz will contact defendant regarding those attorney payments).
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:00 PM   Defendant Shane Michael Mcguire appeared by video.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Shane Michael Mcguire.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Reetz indicates matter is likely to resolve, requests another status.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Reetz letter to court re defendant ill.    Zoom appearance granted.   DTE
Status conference on May 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.
Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

9:56 AM  Defendant Shane Michael Mcguire in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Shane Michael Mcguire.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, indicates defendant wishes to waives his right to a preliminary hearing today.
Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

12:18 PM  Defendant Shane Michael Mcguire appeared by video from the Door County Jail, Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defendant indicates he does not qualify for SPD representation.  Court explains options regarding legal representation to defendant. Court will send petition for court appointed counsel form down to the jail for defendant to fill out if he wishes to go that route.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:45 am.
